subject: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Dear Beneficiary,
 
This is to inform you that in the course of my investigation as director of the payment verification/implementation committee, I came across your name as an unpaid fund beneficiary in the record of the central bank of Nigeria and other banks that are supposed to get your funds amounting on the sum of $6,700,000.00 (Six million seven hundred thousand united states dollars) released to you. My committee was set up by the payment reconciliation committee to verify and scrutinize all outstanding debts owed to our foreign beneficiaries in accordance with the information received from the United States government and other countries over unpaid huge debts owed to Foreigners.
 
Having seen your file and my further questioning to the officials of the central bank of Nigeria and the Ministry of Finance as to why your payment is still pending reveals the rot and corruption in the system.  The bank officials told me that the reason why you haven’t received your payment is due to your inability to pay for the required charges for the transfer of funds to your account. When I asked them why they didn’t deduct the said charges from your principal sum, I was given the flimsy excuse that you never authorized them to do so. When I put the question across to them if they ever advised you that such charges could be deducted from your principal fund, the answer I got was no. Now, if you do not tell this beneficiary that such charges could be deducted from his or her principal fund, how will he or she know that such options are available for such beneficiaries?
 
From my investigation, I discovered that these bank officials deliberately refused to let the charges be deducted from your principal fund because they want your fund to remain trapped in the bank, while they continue to extort money from beneficiaries under some flimsy excuse. You do not need to pay any money to any official, all you are required to do is swear an affidavit at the federal high court of Nigeria, authorizing the bank to deduct all charges from your principal fund and transfer the balance of funds after deduction to your bank account. If you have spent any money in the past in your quest for payment, kindly let me know so that I can follow this up. You can reach me on my phone at +234-8162092939 or email: at 
inquirysection456@outlook.com
 for directives on how you can get the deduction done as soon as possible and get your payment released in your account.
 
Yours sincerely,
Olukayode Ariwoola  (CJN)
CHIEF JUSTICE FEDERAL
REPUBLIC OF NIGERIA
Direct Phone:
Email

subject: Re:   Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Olukayode Ariwoola CJN,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information with me. I must say, it's quite surprising to hear about the unpaid fund in my name. 

I'm curious, how did my name come up in your records? And why was this amount not paid earlier? Also, could you please explain a bit more about these charges that were supposed to be deducted from my principal sum?

You mentioned swearing an affidavit at the federal high court of Nigeria. How does one go about doing that? Is there a specific process or procedure I need to follow?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
James

subject: Re: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
* Dear Beneficiary, (   * *MR JAMES * *)*




*Thanks for your quick reply , following the suspension and sacked of the
Governor Central  Bank of Nigeria Mr Godwin Emefila with other corrupt
officials by the New  President Federal Republic of Nigeria Bola Ahmed
Tinubu, who is not happy the way the the past Governor Central Bank of
Nigeria Mr Godwin Emefila treated all the  Foreigners. beneficiaries  , in
a meeting held today concerning all the  Foreigners. The New President Bola
Ahmed Tinubu has instructed my office (CJN) To set up a committee payment
for reconciliation to verify and scrutinize all outstanding debts owed to
our foreign beneficiaries in accordance with the information received from
the United States government and other countries over unpaid huge debts
owed to Foreigners, this is overdue compensation payment .At this point our
 committee  which i am the Head has completed there reconciliation and
verification/implementation with the  power giving to me to release your
fund i which to informed you that you are not suppose to pay a any fee to
any bank official before you received your fund to your bank account , this
is an ordered from  the office of the new President   Bola Ahmed Tinubu ,
like  i said in my First email You do not need to pay any money to any bank
 official before you received your fund to your bank account , all you are
required to do is swear an affidavit at the federal high court of Nigeria
which will cost you the sum of $1,357, authorizing the bank to deduct all
charges from your principal fund and transfer the balance of funds after
deduction to your bank account.  i will sign the affidavit  by myself as
the current (CJN) as instructed by the new President of Federal Government
of Nigeria, it is important you called me on my direct phone number to
direct you who you should send the $1,357 for the  affidavit  right away .
my phone at  +234-8162092939 or email: at *
*inquirysection456@gmail.com <inquirysection456@gmail.com>  for directives
on how you can get the  affidavit done as soon as possible and get your
payment released in your bank account within  72 hours of this instruction.*








*Yours sincerely,Olukayode Ariwoola  (CJN)CHIEF JUSTICE FEDERALREPUBLIC OF
NIGERIACall me On Direct Phone now : +234-8162092939Email: *
*inquirysection456@gmail.com <inquirysection456@gmail.com>*

subject: Re: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Mr. Ariwoola,

Thank you for your detailed message. It's quite interesting to hear about the changes happening in Nigeria, especially with the new President Bola Ahmed Tinubu taking charge.

I'm glad to know that my overdue payment is being taken care of. However, I have a few questions regarding this process. You mentioned an affidavit that needs to be sworn at the federal high court of Nigeria. Could you please explain more about this? What exactly does it entail and why is it necessary?

Also, you mentioned a certain fee for this affidavit. How much would that be? And how can I make sure that this fee will indeed be used for its intended purpose?

Lastly, you mentioned that all charges will be deducted from my principal fund. Could you provide a breakdown of these charges? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
James

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Mr. Ariwoola,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to hear about the changes happening in Nigeria, especially with the new President Bola Ahmed Tinubu taking charge.

I'm glad to know that my overdue payment is being taken care of by your committee. However, I have a few questions regarding this process. 

Firstly, could you please explain more about this affidavit that needs to be sworn at the federal high court of Nigeria? What exactly does it entail and why is it necessary?

Secondly, you mentioned that there will be some charges deducted from my principal fund. Could you provide a breakdown of these charges?

Lastly, I would like to understand how secure this transfer process is. How can I be assured that my funds will reach me safely?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
James

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
*Dear Beneficiary, (  MR JAMES  )Thanks for your quick reply ,like i said
swear an affidavit at the federal high court of Nigeria  is the only key
for you to received this fund as the new Government instructed , this is
not upfront payment fee as you may think  , the new Government made it
mandatory as the only key over unpaid huge debts owed to Foreigners should
be paid , without the swearing  an affidavit at the federal high court of
Nigeria there is no way this new Government will pay you this fund , this
is compulsory .The  $1,357 can be deduct from the total fund , that is
affidavit fee . If you want to know  more concerning  this affidavit, it is
a grantee process that will make you not pay any transfer fee from the bank
during the time your fund will be transferring to your bank. This affidavit
will empower the bank to deduct any transfer fee/ charges  from your total
fund and pay you the balance, this is the work of * *affidavit * .





*I will use my position to appoint a lawyer from my office to stand on your
behalf at the federal high court of Nigeria for this affidavit and the
Lawyer will not collect any money from you , this is an order from the
office of the Presidency .it is important you know that the only fee you
are to pay here is the affidavit fee which is $1, 357 that is all .Once the
affidavit is concluded your payment fund will be  released in your bank
account within  72 hours of this instruction.*
*The information I need from you for this * *swearing  an affidavit at the
federal high court of Nigeria on your behalf is your current address and
your direct phone number.*






*Yours sincerely,Olukayode Ariwoola  (CJN)CHIEF JUSTICE FEDERALREPUBLIC OF
NIGERIACall me On Direct Phone now : +234-8*

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Mr. James,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the affidavit process at the Federal High Court of Nigeria. It's interesting to learn that this is a mandatory step in order to receive the funds.

I'm curious, could you please explain more about how this affidavit empowers the bank to deduct any transfer fee charges from my total fund? Also, it's reassuring to know that a lawyer will be appointed on my behalf for this process. 

You mentioned an affidavit fee, could you clarify how much this fee is? And how is it usually paid?

Lastly, you asked for my current address and direct phone number. I'm sorry but I am not comfortable sharing personal information online due to privacy concerns. Is there another way we can proceed without me providing these details?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
James

subject: Re: Fwd: Fwd: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Mr. James,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the affidavit process at the Federal High Court of Nigeria. I must admit, this is all new to me and I'm trying my best to understand it.

If I understood correctly, this affidavit is a necessary step in order for me to receive the funds, correct? And you mentioned that it's not an upfront payment fee but rather a mandatory requirement by the new government. That's quite interesting!

You also mentioned that once the affidavit is concluded, my payment fund will be released into my bank account within hours. That sounds very efficient! 

Could you please explain more about how this affidavit empowers the bank to deduct any transfer fee charges from my total fund? Also, how does appointing a lawyer from your office work in this process?

I appreciate your patience in explaining these details to me.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
James

subject: Re: Fwd: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Mr. Ariwoola CJN CHIEF JUSTICE OF,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must admit, I'm not very familiar with legal procedures, especially those in Nigeria. Could you please explain a bit more about this affidavit process? What exactly does it entail and why is it necessary for the transfer of funds?

Also, you mentioned that the only fee I need to pay is for the affidavit. How much would that be? And how can I make sure that this fee will indeed cover all the costs related to the transfer?

I appreciate your patience in explaining these matters to me.

Best wishes,
James
